summary: This document is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, seeking the production of documentary evidence related to a victim (referred to as 'Doe') in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The letter, dated July 8, 2021, follows up on prior requests from October 2020 and argues for the release of evidence (photos, videos, correspondence, financial records) to assist Doe's civil litigation, noting she declined the Epstein Victims' Compensation Fund to pursue her case in court.

connections.description: Co-signatories and attorneys at the same law firm, Edwards Pottinger LLC, working together on the Touhy request for their client.
Edwards is an attorney representing a victim suing Epstein's estate and associates, seeking evidence against Epstein.
Henderson is an attorney representing a victim suing Epstein's estate and associates, seeking evidence against Epstein.
Epstein is described as having repeatedly sexually assaulted and trafficked the victim 'Doe' from 2006 to 2013.
Both served as United States Attorneys for the Southern District of New York, with Berman being the predecessor to Strauss.

events.title: Sexual Abuse of Victim Doe
events.description: The period during which Jeffrey Epstein repeatedly sexually assaulted and trafficked the victim referred to as 'Doe', starting when she was twenty years old.

events.title: Initial Touhy Request Submission
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC sent the initial formal written Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office via FedEx, seeking evidence for victim Doe.

events.title: Follow-up Touhy Request Submission
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC sent a follow-up formal written Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office via FedEx and email.

events.title: Final Touhy Request Follow-up
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC sent a final follow-up letter to U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, reiterating the request for evidence and noting the victim's decision to proceed to trial.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein, referred to as 'Doe', was sexually assaulted and trafficked by him from 2006 through 2013.
The victim's attorneys are seeking extensive documentary evidence from the DOJ via a Touhy request, including photos, videos, correspondence, and financial records related to the abuse.
The victim declined an offer from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Fund and is proceeding to trial in the Southern District of New York to obtain justice.
The request argues that the evidence is not privileged, is essential to the civil case, and its disclosure would not interfere with law enforcement proceedings.
The document includes proof of prior submissions in October 2020 and FedEx delivery confirmations to the U.S. Attorney's Office.
